name: Chlorine-modified methacrylate
discription: A chlorine-modified methacrylate monomer or oligomer designed to enhance adhesion, water resistance, and resistance to boiling water in polymer systems.
typical_properties: Active ingredient content: ≥96. Viscosity: 20-40 mPa·s. Key properties: Adhesion, water resistance, water resistant boiling. Physical Properties: Microyellow transparent liquid.
other_industries: Used in specialty coatings, adhesives, sealants, and resins where improved adhesion to various substrates, enhanced water resistance, and durability under harsh (e.g., boiling water) conditions are required.

name: Caprolactone Acrylate
discription: A caprolactone-modified acrylate monomer or oligomer, used to impart high flexibility and improved impact resistance to cured polymers.
typical_properties: Active ingredient content: ≥96. Viscosity: 30-50 mPa·s. Key properties: High flexibility, improve impact resistance. Physical Properties: Colorless to slightly yellowish, transparent liquid.
other_industries: Used in the formulation of flexible coatings, adhesives, sealants, elastomers, and as an impact modifier for plastics and resins; enhances toughness and elongation characteristics of cured materials.

name: Caprolactone Acrylate (with long chain segments)
discription: A caprolactone-modified acrylate, featuring long chain segments, specifically engineered to provide significant flexibility and enhanced impact resistance to polymer formulations.
typical_properties: Active ingredient content: ≥96. Viscosity: 60-80 mPa·s. Key properties: Long chain segments, high flexibility, improve impact resistance. Physical Properties: Colorless to slightly yellowish, transparent liquid.
other_industries: Utilized in applications demanding superior flexibility and toughness, such as flexible films, coatings for pliable substrates, impact-resistant plastics, soft-touch finishes, and certain types of adhesives.

name: Chlorine-modified acrylate
discription: A chlorine-modified acrylate monomer or oligomer, primarily used to improve adhesion and water resistance in polymeric systems.
typical_properties: Active ingredient content: ≥96. Viscosity: 30-70 mPa·s. Key properties: Adhesion and water resistance. Physical Properties: Microyellow transparent liquid.
other_industries: Incorporated into formulations for coatings, adhesives, and sealants to enhance bonding to various substrates and to improve the overall water resistance of the cured product.

name: Chlorine-modified phenoxyacrylate (lower viscosity)
discription: A chlorine-modified phenoxyacrylate designed to provide improved adhesion and water resistance. This version has a lower viscosity range.
typical_properties: Active ingredient content: ≥96. Viscosity: 2500-5000 mPa·s. Key properties: Adhesion and water resistance. Physical Properties: Microyellow transparent liquid.
other_industries: Used in specialty coatings, adhesives, and encapsulants where enhanced adhesion, particularly to challenging substrates, and superior water resistance are crucial. The phenoxy group can also contribute to chemical resistance.

name: Chlorine-modified phenoxyacrylate (higher viscosity, with long-chain segments)
discription: A chlorine-modified phenoxyacrylate featuring long-chain segments, formulated for excellent adhesion and water resistance. This version has a higher viscosity range.
typical_properties: Active ingredient content: ≥96. Viscosity: 5000-8000 mPa·s. Key properties: Long-chain segments, adhesion, and water resistance. Physical Properties: Microyellow transparent liquid.
other_industries: Employed in high-performance coatings, adhesives, and laminates requiring robust adhesion, water resistance, and potentially improved flexibility due to long-chain segments.

name: Special phenoxyl acrylate
discription: A specially formulated phenoxyl acrylate designed to improve adhesion and tenacity in polymer systems.
typical_properties: Active ingredient content: ≥96. Viscosity: 100-300 mPa·s. Key properties: Improve adhesion and tenacity. Physical Properties: Microyellow transparent liquid.
other_industries: Used as an additive or comonomer in coatings, adhesives, and composites to enhance bond strength, toughness, and overall durability of the cured material.

name: Cycloacrylate
discription: A type of acrylate monomer or oligomer containing cyclic structures, characterized by high solid content, low viscosity, high Glass Transition Temperature (TG), high hardness, and good solvent resistance.
typical_properties: Active ingredient content: ≥98. Viscosity: 10-30 mPa·s. Key properties: High solid and low viscosity, high TG, high hardness, and solvent resistance. Physical Properties: Colorless to slightly yellowish, transparent liquid.
other_industries: Used in UV/EB curable coatings, inks, and adhesives where rapid cure, high hardness, scratch resistance, chemical resistance, and good thermal stability are desired. Common in optical coatings and hard coats.

name: Isoopneyl Acrylate
discription: An acrylate monomer, possibly with a branched or cyclic alkyl group (name 'Isoopneyl' is unusual, potentially a misspelling of isopentyl, isophoryl or similar). It is characterized by high solid content, low viscosity, high Glass Transition Temperature (TG), high hardness, and good solvent resistance.
typical_properties: Active ingredient content: ≥98. Viscosity: 10-30 mPa·s. Key properties: High solid and low viscosity, high TG, high hardness, and solvent resistance. Physical Properties: Colorless to slightly yellowish, transparent liquid.
other_industries: Likely used in UV/EB curable formulations for coatings, inks, and specialty resins, contributing to high hardness, chemical resistance, and thermal properties. Suitable for applications needing durable finishes.

name: Modified Acrylamide
discription: A modified acrylamide monomer or oligomer designed to provide high hardness, high Glass Transition Temperature (TG), and improved adhesion characteristics in polymer systems.
typical_properties: Active ingredient content: ≥98. Viscosity: 10-30 mPa·s. Key properties: High hardness, high TG, and improved adhesion. Physical Properties: Colorless to slightly yellowish, transparent liquid.
other_industries: Used in coatings, adhesives, and composites where enhanced mechanical strength, thermal stability, and strong bonding to substrates are required. Can be used in specialty resins and UV/EB curable systems.

name: Methylphosphate Ester Ecrylate
discription: An acrylate monomer containing a methylphosphate ester group, specifically designed for enhanced adhesion to metal and glass substrates, and offering resistance to boiling.
typical_properties: Active ingredient content: ≥96. Viscosity: 600-1200 mPa·s. Key properties: Metal glass adhesion, resistant to boiling. Physical Properties: Microyellow transparent liquid.
other_industries: Used as an adhesion promoter in coatings, adhesives, and sealants for metal and glass surfaces. Suitable for applications requiring strong bonding and durability under humid or high-temperature conditions, such as protective coatings for electronics or automotive parts.

name: Double-ring-modified Ecrylate
discription: An acrylate monomer or oligomer modified with double-ring structures, aimed at providing broad substrate adhesion and good water resistance.
typical_properties: Active ingredient content: ≥96. Viscosity: 10-30 mPa·s. Key properties: Various substrate adhesion, water resistance. Physical Properties: Colorless to slightly yellowish, transparent liquid.
other_industries: Used in universal primers, coatings, and adhesives designed to bond to a wide range of materials. The double-ring structure may contribute to hardness, chemical resistance, and thermal stability.

name: Cyclic trihydroxy shrink with formaldehyde acrylate
discription: A complex acrylate monomer derived from a cyclic trihydroxy compound and potentially formaldehyde, engineered for broad substrate adhesion, water resistance, and tenacity.
typical_properties: Active ingredient content: ≥96. Viscosity: 10-30 mPa·s. Key properties: Various substrate adhesion, water resistance, tenacity. Physical Properties: Microyellow transparent liquid.
other_industries: Used in high-performance coatings, adhesives, and composites requiring strong adhesion to diverse substrates, durability, and good water resistance. The term 'shrink' might imply low shrinkage upon curing.

name: Tercarbonate-modified Acrylate
discription: An acrylate monomer or oligomer modified with tertiary carbonate groups, designed to improve yellowing resistance, flexibility, adhesion, and resistance to boiling.
typical_properties: Active ingredient content: ≥96. Viscosity: 100-500 mPa·s. Key properties: Improve yellow resistance, flexibility, adhesion, boiling. Physical Properties: Microyellow transparent liquid.
other_industries: Used in durable coatings (e.g., outdoor applications, automotive topcoats), adhesives, and sealants where non-yellowing properties, flexibility, good adhesion, and resistance to harsh conditions are important.

name: Pt-carbonate-modified Phenoxyacrylate
discription: A phenoxyacrylate modified with platinum-carbonate structures or similar functionalities, aimed at improving yellowing resistance, flexibility, adhesion, resistance to boiling, and providing softer, impact-resistant long-chain sections.
typical_properties: Active ingredient content: ≥96. Viscosity: 3000-5000 mPa·s. Key properties: Improve yellow resistance, flexibility, adhesion, boiled, long chain section softer, impact. Physical Properties: Microyellow transparent liquid.
other_industries: Used in advanced coatings, adhesives, and flexible electronics applications requiring exceptional durability, non-yellowing characteristics, good adhesion, impact resistance, and flexibility over a wide range of conditions.
